item.title: Network Safety Restart
item.author: Steve Francia
item.description:
if you are working on your remote servers networking setup, then this can be a life saver. You start the following script just before you make a change. Then without a worry you can make changes to your network setting. If the settings are wrong although you maybe disconnected this script will re-install a working backup for you and restart your server. All you have to do is wait a few minutes.

This command

# network_Safety_Restart.sh start

Will wait for 1200 second and then do following

cp /etc/network/interfaces.org /etc/network/interfaces

restart

if during the time you find that your changes are working and you don’t need a restart you can simply stop it with

# network_Safety_Restart.sh stop
